abstract: Archivist Richard Carter has created an imaginative mash-up, highlighting the flavour of the 5000 films produced by the Commonwealth Government over the last 100 years.
description: A brief history of the government film agencies from 1913 onwards. Includes a selection of Film Australia footage representing a snapshot of the collection's rich and varied themes such as employment and industry, agriculture, war, immigration, Royal visits, Indigenous Australians and general way of life. The NFSA mash-up features the original location in Melbourne of the Cinema and Photographic Branch and its head Cameraman Bert Ive. Other people featured include Stanley Hawes (National Film Board Producer in Chief), Chips Rafferty and Peter Weir. Source: NFSA Film Australia Collection.
